ygData.subject: Re: Laptops & EQ
ygData.msgSnippet: Well I play on a laptop quite a bit, my speed is fine, but the graphics are white in areas far from where I zone in, or log in at, it is perfect for travel,
ygData.messageBody:
Well I play on a laptop quite a bit, my speed is fine, but the graphics are
white in areas far from where I zone in, or log in at, it is perfect for
travel, cause I know the routes by heart, and questing, and skill raising,
Ive even camped areas quite well, areas that I know VERY well

Jaezebel Moonsong

PS- My laptop is approaching a year old.

That New Inspiron is my next choice also and I am counting the days till I
decide to splurge for it....
-----Original Message-----
From: Bob Stewart <dreambard@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, October 04, 1999 3:34 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Laptops & EQ


>From: Bob Stewart <dreambard@...>
>
>At 12:05 PM 04-10-99 -0600, Blair, Keith (Keith Blair) wrote:
>>Has anyone ever gotten EQ to work on a laptop? I'm purchasing a laptop,
but
>>would like to find one that could run EQ as well so I could run my bard
all
>>around while I run around. If anyone has any recommendations or
experiences,
>>please share them.
>
>I asked the same question a while back and couldn't find much solid
>information. I've yet to find anyone who has experience with playing
>EverQuest on a laptop.
>
>As I type this I'm waiting for Dell to call me back so I can order an
>Inspiron 7500. As far as I can tell it will run EverQuest pretty well. I
>talked to 989 Systems support and was told the ATI Rage Mobility 3D
>hardware in the Dell is sufficient for EverQuest even though they don't
>list it as supported.
>
>Ultimately I won't know until I try it. Dell has a 30-day satisfaction
>guarantee, so if it doesn't work I'm not stuck.
>
>I'll report back how fast Thrush runs on the Inspiron, probably in a couple
>weeks.
>
> Bob
>
>
